meanings.definition: Using or expending resources carelessly or extravagantly.
meanings.sent1: Her wastefulness habits led to a lot of food being thrown away.
meanings.sent2: The wastefulness behavior of leaving lights on when not needed is harmful to the environment.
meanings.sent3: The wastefulness use of paper plates at the party made the host regret not using reusable ones.
meanings.sent4: His wastefulness spending on unnecessary gadgets drained his savings like a leaky faucet.
meanings.sent5: The wastefulness use of water during the drought painted a vivid picture of scarcity.

meanings.definition: The quality or state of being wasteful.
meanings.sent1: The wastefulness of the project's budget was evident in the excessive spending on unnecessary items.
meanings.sent2: She was frustrated by the wastefulness of leaving the tap running while brushing teeth.
meanings.sent3: The wastefulness of time spent on social media made him realize he could be more productive.
meanings.sent4: The wastefulness of energy in the empty office building was like money going up in smoke.
meanings.sent5: The wastefulness of resources in the company was a glaring issue that needed to be addressed.
